reviewText: Ebbie from on TV many years ago - a bit different name on this DVD.  I searched for it for years and finally stopped looking.  But stumbled across it by accident this year.  Susan Lucci - she's so good at what she does.  I thoroughly enjoy her in this movie and also Wendy Crew who has done so many good things in movies.  The guys who play Jake Marley and Ebbie's "squeeze" Paul are good additions, nice acting.  It's an all around good movie.  If you like it you might also give a look at A Carol Christmas - another update on the old story, about another Type A female who "sees the light".
Title: Miracle at Christmas: Ebbie's Story MP3s for Christmas

reviewText: I have seen most of the movies that are based on Charles Dickens' "Christmas Carol, and in my opinion this one ranks up there with the better ones.  The interesting thing is, of course, that in this case Scrooge is a woman, capably portrayed by Susan Lucci.  Actually, most of the other roles are taken by women.  An interesting idea.
Title: Miracle at Christmas: Ebbie's Story MP3s for Christmas

reviewText: I have always loved this version of A Christmas Carol with Susan Lucci. In the last couple of years it hasn't been shown, and since I cut the cable cord earlier last year I didn't think I would ever see it again. I was thrilled to find it at Amazon!! Yay!
summary: This is one of my favorite holiday movies

reviewText: What woman doesn't like Ebbie's Story. It is a simple story of a woman, Ebbie's, who dos not care about the people around her. That is until the Ghost of Christmas Past, present, and Future visit her to show her exactly who she was and what will become of her if she doesn't change. It is light hearted a with a happy ending.
Title: Miracle at Christmas: Ebbie's Story MP3s for Christmas

reviewText: This is a retelling of A Christmas Carol set in modern times.  Ebeneezer Scrooge has been replaced with Elizabeth "Ebbie" Scrooge (Susan Lucci).  Where Ebeneezer was a miser who treated everyone badly Ebbie is the tyrannical owner of Dobson's department store and she follows in her namesake's footsteps.  As with every version of the story she has her life turned around and is saved by the spirits.  While not quite up to the level of the Alastair Sim or George C. Scott versions, it is still fun to watch.
Title: Miracle at Christmas: Ebbie's Story MP3s for Christmas
